author: arnetheduck
content: one final thing that hits epoch transitions is database pruning: when finalization happens, we can get rid of a lot of stuff and this takes places on the transition usually - in the future, we'll likely queue up such work and spread it out for when there is less processing to do, but for internal consistency reasons, doing it right on finalization is the easiest strategy - it would be interesting to see the effect of this vs the effect of having many heads
